Message.Title: Profound Info One Can Trust
Message.Msg: Two major signs recently occured to enable insight. First the banks have eased lending standards and second the Israel attack on Syria has significance. For those interested, the below info shall not dissappoint. With the lending for mortgages easing is a sign it is bubbling rapidly. Real Estate has a profound impact of what is to happen on global scale. What the adverserary did in a past generation is to repeat history even now. We go back to the mindset of the adverserary....Then they said to one another, "Come let us make bricks and bake them thoroughly, They made brick for stone, and they had asphalt for mortar. And they said, Come let us build ourselves a city, and a tower(Babylon) whose tops is in the heavens... (Gen 11:3-4) For the city to function they needed building to attract the peoples so the bricks and stone was for the establishment of appealing Real Estate. Asphalt was used as a binding agent and it is petroleum based and so, oil will be the binding agent to get to a new world order. THe USA(Rev 13:11-17) plays a huge role in prophecy and for it to control economies via the NWO, it must first control the oil spout in the Middle East. That's why economic sanctions are used to convert because no country can survive without oil-energy. And he(USA) causes all ...to receive a mark on their hand(econimic) or on their foreheads=spiritual(Rev 13:15). The Japan Fukashima nuclear disaster was to end global nuclear energy expansion. Now we see Israel strike Syria to eventually draw Iran and OPEC into the conflict. We already seen Iraq, Libya and Egypt go down.......Oil is the true currency as we approach a currency collapse, and, what's behind it? You(antichrist) will come up against My people like a cloud, to cover(control) the land. It will be in the latter days that I will bring you against My land=people.Eze 38 15-16 The currency collapse will burst global real estate and the real estate goes back to the Elite. Seek to know God and be blessed

Message.Title: Looks like 260 is not going to be the ceiling today.
Message.Msg: Once, somebody was told that there was a tiger running loose in town. He of course did not believe it. A few minutes later, another guy told him the same thing. He still does not believe it. Then a few minute later, yet another guy told him there was a tiger running loose in town. Now he became panic, started to telling everyone that there was a tiger running loose in town, and joined all the people finding a safe place to hide. Three people makes a tiger. "How in the world can internet tax be good for Amazon?" No, it cannot. But if there are enough people saying that it can, it still cannot, but AMZN can be made to go up. One got to love capitalism.

Topic.Title: Looks like 260 is not going to be the ceiling today.

Message.Msg: Internet tax is good for amazon because it is already charging or plans to be charging taxes in almost 50% of america. My opinion is there should be a 6% flat sales tax that goes to the nation. The US government pays a lot to keep the internet safe. States do not have to pay a lot for infrastructure for these online merchants. Besides sales tax goes to the general fund where it is then used to pay for things that the US government usually subsidizes anyways. Something like half the states run a deficit with the US government. What surprises me is my home state of California actually has a surplus. And yet we have a huge deficit within the state. I think that is wrong when other states run a deficit with the fed but they have a state surplus. Seems to me like the fed and the states need to get more inline with fiscal responsibilities. Amazon will be at a disadvantage to other online merchants in CA, New York, Texas, Florida and several other states. Online tax will help even the playing field for Amazon.

Message.Msg: It is very bad for the small guys, no matter however "easy" technology can make it, period. But Amazon's true competitors are not the small guys. In fact, I become bearish on Amazon when I realized that Amazon is no longer fighting for these small guys and EBAY become the flag carrier for small merchants.

Topic.Title: Bogus lifting of this equity is almost comical

Message.Msg: except for the bots of course...you gotta love them black boxes...

They had a 10c benefit from a one-time tax gain, to meet meet massively reduced expectation of 8c. They missed on revs and guided Q2 significantly lower on revs. They also guided to a operating loss, which was completely unexpected. The street reduced its EPS target for Q2 from 22c all the way down to 7c (70% reduction). Full year CY13 was also reduced for both revs and EPS estimates. All of this for a company with a forward P/E of well over 100. I'd say that's pretty disappointing. What is amazing is that they are only down about 6% on continued underperformance to significantly reduced expectations. All in the name of "they will make profit some day". I guess that argument will always work as long as people want to beleive it.

Topic.Title: Looks like 260 is not going to be the ceiling today.

Message.Msg: If the law passes the congress, you'll see everyone flogs over to Alibaba and other overseas establishements. The government knows it will be the case, the next thing will be global tax. That's what the libs want in the end. You know it will come one day.

Topic.Title: Looks like 260 is not going to be the ceiling today.

Message.Msg: This will kill online commerce a little bit. People who used to enjoy the tax-free online purchases are now have to think a little harder before they bought their 20th pair of pants or 3 pair of shoes if the "tax" discount is not there. The reason the small guys are fried is because they have to pay something like 12-15% of the transaction costs if they are a vendor on Amazon/Ebay so they will loose out by the transaction costs. Other medium to smaller vendors will loose some customers as well. Winners will obviously be retailers or international small time vendors since the shipping fees are negated by the tax. The economy is weak enough as is, any more taxation and you will see spending go down at least for some time. BTW, Amazon doesn't even have the best prices on many items is just that their return policy is second to none.

I totally agree that's typically how the market works. It just like in a bear when good news is ignored and when perceived bad to OK news has the market react positively. The difference here is the unprecedented action by the Fed and Central banks, eventually there will be a tipping point.

I meant to say when good news is ignored in a bear market and then all of a sudden the market reacts positively to some so-so news, i.e. usually a trend reversal. Here, eventually the markets will have fully baked in all the FED action and suddenly bad news will be perceived as bad news and the market will act accordingly. It's difficult to say when this might happen or what may cause it with so much supply coming into the market

Message.Title: FPE of 80
Message.Msg: FPE is held up by ether right now. Who in their right mind believes AMZN will go from losses per share and sometimes pennies per share to $3 bucks and change per share. The forward CAGR these analysts are using keep going up to support the valuation. There has never been proof that AMZN can even generate Safeway type margins without the help of FX and oddball accounting tricks like extending payables to extreme levels.

I'm slowly making progress in exposing this specific scam. I will be meeting with the ideal person to expose it soon and I am happy to let her get all the credit. This will be the 2010's version of Enron of there is a market shock, except that the negligence (fraud is a higher standard) will not have been committed by management, but by certain financial institutions.

Topic.Title: Look out over yonder from the hieghts of a mkt blowoff top

Message.Msg: Kind of like knowing the difference between then and than....

Neither the twelve month forward PE (what used to be considered the FPE before WS needed to move the goalposts to pretend stocks are still cheap) nor the 2014 PE will turn out to be 80 or below. The underlying earnings trends are clear and they are being driven by evolving cost drivers. This has been a trading scam and nothing more. The analyst community has been completely complicit in this scam. If they still did fundamental economic analysis and evaluated the cost drivers and trends, they would have already reset price targets into the low 100's.
